intro: Licania prismatocarpa, commonly known as the prism-ribbed licania, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in moist, shaded environments. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds.
